author: Megumi Fujikawa
title: Japan Asserts Right With WTO to Retaliate Against U.S. Tariffs
text:
TOKYO—Japan on Friday formally threatened retaliation against the U.S. over the Trump administration’s steel tariffs, dropping the more conciliatory approach it had taken with its closest ally.
In a filing at the World Trade Organization, Japan said it was reserving the right under WTO rules to impose retaliatory tariffs of more than $400 million. It said it hadn’t decided whether it would actually do so.
